    "in this section , we recall main notions and definitions from ergodic theory ( called also measurable dynamics ) , borel , and cantor dynamics which are used in the paper .",
    "we will keep the notation from this section throughout the paper .",
    "let @xmath10 be a topological space .",
    "the class @xmath11 of borel sets of @xmath10 is the @xmath12-algebra generated by open sets .",
    "we call @xmath13 the borel space",
    ". a separable complete metric space @xmath14 is called a polish space .",
    "let @xmath15 be the @xmath12-algebra of borel subsets of @xmath14 .",
    "a borel space @xmath13 is called a _ standard borel space _ if it is isomorphic to a polish space @xmath16 .",
    "any two standard borel spaces are isomorphic .",
    "let @xmath17 denote the set of all borel probability measures on @xmath13 .",
    "a measure @xmath18 is called _ non - atomic _ ( or continuous ) if @xmath19 .",
    "the measure , supported by a point @xmath20 , is denoted by @xmath21 . two measures @xmath22 and @xmath23 are called _ equivalent _ ( in symbols , @xmath24 ) if they have the same collection of subsets of measure zero .    a one - to - one borel map @xmath25 of @xmath10 onto itself is called an _ automorphism _ of @xmath13 . denote by @xmath2 the group of all borel automorphisms of @xmath13 . for @xmath26 , the set @xmath27",
    "is called the _ support _ of @xmath25 .",
    "let @xmath28 denote the set of automorphisms with at most countable support , i.e. , @xmath29 if @xmath30 . clearly , @xmath28 is a normal subgroup of @xmath31 .",
    "the quotient group @xmath32 is obtained by identifying automorphisms from @xmath2 which differ on an at most countable set .    for @xmath33 and @xmath34 ,",
    "let @xmath35 denote the @xmath25-orbit of @xmath36 .",
    "a point @xmath34 is called a _ periodic point _ of period @xmath37 if @xmath38 and @xmath39 .",
    "an automorphism @xmath25 is called _ pointwise periodic _ ( or periodic ) if every point @xmath20 is periodic for @xmath25 , and @xmath25 is called _ aperiodic _ if it has no periodic points , i.e. every @xmath25-orbit is infinite .",
    "we denote by @xmath40 and @xmath41 the sets of pointwise periodic and aperiodic automorphisms , respectively .",
    "a borel automorphism @xmath42 is called _ smooth _ if there is a borel subset @xmath43 ( called _ wandering _ ) that meets every @xmath25-orbit exactly ones .",
    "we denote the class of smooth automorphisms by @xmath44 . by our definition ,",
    "every pointwise periodic automorphism is smooth .",
    "given @xmath33 , denote by @xmath45 the set of @xmath25-invariant borel probability measures . in particular , @xmath45 may be empty .",
    "an automorphism @xmath25 is called _ incompressible _ if @xmath46 ( in symbols , @xmath47 ) .    by definition ,",
    "the _ full group _ of @xmath42 is @xmath48=\\{s\\in aut(x,{\\mathcal b } ) : orb_s(x)\\subset orb_t(x),\\;x\\in x\\}$ ] .",

    ", we note that any uncountable borel subset of a polish space together with a borel measure on it is an example of a standard measure space .",

    "if @xmath25 does not admit an invariant ( finite or infinite ) measure equivalent to @xmath22 , then @xmath25 is called of type @xmath90 .",
    "automorphisms of type @xmath90 are divided into the subtypes @xmath91 , @xmath92 , and @xmath93 ( see @xcite for details ) .",
    "let @xmath6 be a compact metric space .",
    "denote by @xmath7 the group of all homeomorphisms of @xmath6 .",
    "we say that @xmath94 is _ topologically transitive _ if there is @xmath95 such that @xmath96 is dense in @xmath6 .",
    "also , @xmath25 is called _ minimal _ if every @xmath25-orbit is dense in @xmath6 or , equivalently , @xmath25 has no proper closed invariant subsets .",
    "it is said that @xmath94 is _ mixing _ if for every non - empty open subsets @xmath97 there exists @xmath98 such that @xmath99 for all @xmath100 .",
    "the sets of all minimal and mixing homeomorphisms will be denoted by @xmath101 and @xmath102 , respectively .",
    "a homeomorphism @xmath25 of @xmath6 is called _ weakly mixing _ if @xmath103 is transitive on @xmath104 .",
    "notice that an odometer @xmath58 is obviously a minimal homeomorphism .",
    "we say that @xmath4 is a _",
    "cantor set _ if it is homeomorphic to a compact metric space without isolated points whose base consists of clopen sets .",
    "all cantor sets are homeomorphic .    for aperiodic @xmath105 ,",

    "in this section , we collect a number of results about topological properties of @xmath0 and @xmath112 .",
    "these results are not new and presented here to emphasize some parallels with results proved for borel and cantor dynamics .",
    "let @xmath111 be the group of all non - singular measurable automorphisms of a standard measure space @xmath68 with @xmath113 . using the ideas which first appeared in @xcite , one can introduce two topologies on @xmath111 generated by the metrics @xmath114 and @xmath115 . for @xmath116",
    ", set @xmath117 @xmath118 where @xmath119 is a countable family of measurable subsets generating @xmath59 .",
    "it is well known that the topologies defined by the metrics ( [ d_u ] ) and ( [ d_w ] ) do not depend on a measure from the class @xmath120 $ ] of measures equivalent to @xmath22 .",
    "we will follow the long established tradition in ergodic theory to call them the _ uniform and weak topologies _",
    ", respectively . clearly , the uniform topology is strictly stronger than the weak topology .",
    "these topologies on the groups @xmath111 and @xmath5 have been studied in many papers .",
    "we summarize the obtained results on topological and algebraic properties of these groups in the next two theorems .",
    "[ aut - un ] @xmath121 the uniform topology on @xmath111 is equivalent to the topology generated by the metric @xmath122 @xmath123 @xmath124 is a non - separable complete metric space and a topological group .",
    "+ @xmath125 @xmath5 is closed in @xmath124 ; + @xmath126 @xmath111 ( and @xmath5 ) has no outer group automorphisms and has no closed normal subgroups with respect to the uniform topology .",
    "+ @xmath127 the topological space @xmath124 is path - connected and simple connected .",
    "+ @xmath128 the topological space @xmath5 is contractible in the uniform topology .",
    "some of these results are rather simple exercises which are known for a long time .",
    "statements ( 1 ) and ( 2 ) were firstly proved in @xcite for the group @xmath5 and then they were used by many authors in more general settings ( see e.g. @xcite , @xcite , @xcite , @xcite ) . the algebraic and topological structures of @xmath111 ( and @xmath5 ) were studied in @xcite , @xcite , @xcite , @xcite , and some other papers .",
    "the fact that the space @xmath0 is path - connected and even simple connected was proved in @xcite .",
    "notice also that the contractibility of @xmath5 was established in @xcite .",
    "let @xmath129 be the unitary operator @xmath129 acting on @xmath130 as follows : @xmath131 @xmath129 is called the operator associated to @xmath73 .",
    "the group @xmath111 endowed with weak topology has the following topological properties .",
    "[ aut - w ] @xmath121 @xmath0 is a polish space and a topological group with respect to the weak topology .",
    "+ @xmath123 a sequence of automorphisms @xmath132 converges to @xmath25 in the weak topology if and only if @xmath133 converges to @xmath129 in the strong ( weak ) operator topology .",
    "+ @xmath125 the groups @xmath5 and @xmath111 are contractible in the weak topology .",
    "+ @xmath126 @xmath5 is closed in @xmath0 with respect to the weak topology .",
    "+ @xmath127 the set @xmath134 is a meager subset in @xmath135 .",
    "+    notice that statement ( 3 ) was proved in @xcite for the group @xmath5 and then later it was generalized to @xmath111 in @xcite .",
    "statement ( 5 ) , which asserts , in other words , that the set of automorphisms of type @xmath87 is meager in @xmath0 , was established in @xcite ( the first example of a non - singular automorphism which does not in @xmath134 was found by ornstein ) . observe that since @xmath135 is separable , one can find various classes of automorphisms which are dense in @xmath0 in @xmath115 .",
    "for example , assuming @xmath136 $ ] , the set of cyclic binary permutations on @xmath137 $ ] is dense in @xmath115 . in @xcite ,",

    "let @xmath25 be an aperiodic finite measure preserving automorphism of @xmath68 .",
    "then given @xmath140 and @xmath141 , there exists a set @xmath74 such that @xmath142 and _ @xmath143    based on this result , rokhlin @xcite showed that the set @xmath40 of periodic automorphisms is _ dense _ in @xmath5 with respect to the uniform topology : _ for @xmath144 , and @xmath141 , there exists @xmath145 such that @xmath146 . _",
    "the rokhlin lemma lies in the basis of many areas of ergodic theory .",
    "the key concept related to this result is a tower constructed by an automorphism @xmath25 : a collection of disjoint sets @xmath147 is called a tower ( or @xmath25-tower ) of height @xmath37 with base @xmath148 .",
    "the formulated above results can be generalized in several directions .",
    "firstly , one can prove that every non - singular automorphism is also approximated by periodic automorphisms in the uniform topology @xcite ( the rokhlin lemma for non - singular automorphisms ) , that is the set of periodic automorphisms , @xmath40 , is dense in @xmath149 .",
    "secondly , s.  alpern @xcite , @xcite proved a multiple rokhlin tower theorem for measure preserving and non - singular aperiodic automorphisms which shows that the space @xmath10 can be partitioned into a finite or infinitely countable number of towers of prescribed measures .",
    "[ multitower ] for any @xmath150 , let @xmath151 be relatively prime positive integers and let @xmath152 be positive numbers such that @xmath153 . then for any aperiodic @xmath154 there exists sets @xmath155 , with @xmath156 and such that @xmath157 is a partition of @xmath10 .    in the next sections",
    ", we will discuss the rokhlin lemma type results in borel and cantor dynamics .",
    "it will be shown below that , like in ergodic theory , the underlying space is partitioned into a finite or countable collection of towers for these dynamics .",
    "let @xmath158 be a topological group .",
    "following @xcite , we say that _ @xmath158 has the _ rokhlin property _",
    "if there exists some @xmath159 such that the conjugates of @xmath160 constitute a dense subset in @xmath158_.     "these results are due to halmos @xcite for measure preserving automorphisms .",
    "theorem [ rokhl - prop ] was generalized to the group @xmath0 in @xcite and @xcite .",
    "also the case of an infinite @xmath12-finite invariant measure was considered in @xcite .",
    "note that these statements are very useful for proving the density and @xmath139-ness of various classes of automorphisms .      in this part",
    ", we will consider the following classes of automorphisms of a measure space : periodic , aperiodic , ergodic , mixing and weakly mixing , zero entropy , and of a finite rank .    as mentioned above",
    ", periodic automorphisms form a dense subset in @xmath0 with respect to the uniform and weak topologies : @xmath162    furthermore , the following two simple facts hold for the set of aperiodic automorphisms : ( 1 ) _ the set @xmath41 is a closed nowhere dense subset in @xmath0 with respect to the uniform topology ; @xmath123 the set @xmath41 is dense in @xmath0 with respect to @xmath115 . _",
    "clearly , the first result is an immediate consequence of the rokhlin lemma . on the other hand ,",
    "the second statement follows from the rokhlin property .",
    "recall that a set of a topological space is called _ generic _ ( or _ typical _ ) if it contains a dense @xmath139 subset .    in @xcite ,",
    "halmos answered the very important question about genericity of ergodic transformations .",
    "[ erg - meas ] the set of ergodic automorphisms is a dense @xmath139 subset of @xmath5 with respect to the weak topology and a nowhere dense subset in the uniform topology .    in the paper @xcite , this result was generalized to the group @xmath0 and to the group @xmath163 where @xmath23 is an infinite @xmath12-finite measure equivalent to @xmath22 .",
    "furthermore , the choksi - kakutani result on genericity of ergodics was improved in @xcite by showing that the ergodic type @xmath93 automorphisms form a dense @xmath139 subset in @xmath135 .    in @xcite",
    ", it was proved that finite measure preserving ergodic automorphisms constitute a dense @xmath139 subset in @xmath41 with respect to the uniform topology .",
    "it can be easily seen that ergodics are dense in non - singular aperiodic automorphisms in @xmath114 .",
    "let @xmath6 be a compact metric space .",
    "a borel probability measure @xmath22 on @xmath6 is called an oxtoby - ulam measure ( o - u measure ) if it is non - atomic and positive on every non - empty open set . if @xmath6 is a connected compact manifold , then additionally the o - u measure @xmath22 must be zero on the boundary @xmath164 . the following result , proved in @xcite ,",
    "states that a typical homeomorphism of @xmath6 is ergodic :    [ erg ] let @xmath22 be an o - u measure on a compact manifold @xmath6 , @xmath165 .",
    "then the set of @xmath22-ergodic homeomorphisms of @xmath6 is a dense @xmath139 subset in the group @xmath166 of all @xmath22-preserving homeomorphisms of @xmath6 with respect to the topology of uniform convergence . in particular",
    ", every compact manifold supports an ergodic homeomorphism .",
    "it is worth to mention one of the main results from @xcite .",
    "namely , it was proved that the natural embedding of @xmath166 into the space @xmath167 preserves @xmath139-ness .",
    "let @xmath168 be an o - u measure on a compact connected manifold @xmath6 .",
    "let @xmath169 be a conjugate invariant , weak topology @xmath139 subset subset of @xmath170 , which contains an aperiodic automorphism .",
    "then @xmath171 is a dense @xmath139 subset of @xmath166 with respect to the topology of uniform convergence .",
    "the statistical ( asymptotical ) properties of an ergodic automorphism are , in general , rather poor .",
    "the dynamical systems generated by mixing and weakly mixing automorphisms have more developed statistical properties .",
    "the study of such automorphisms was begun in the papers @xcite , @xcite , @xcite , @xcite . now there exist a large number of articles devoted to mixing and weakly mixing automorphisms .",
    "we mention here only the classical results .",
    "[ mix ] @xmath121 the set of weakly mixing automorphisms forms a dense @xmath139 subset in @xmath5 with respect to the weak topology ; + @xmath123 the set of mixing automorphisms is a meager subset of @xmath5 with respect to the uniform topology .",
    "another crucial notion of ergodic theory is _ entropy _ discovered by kolmogorov and studied later in works by rokhlin , sinai , ornstein , and many others . in @xcite , the following generic set was found :    [ 0-entr ] automorphisms of zero entropy form a dense @xmath139 subset of @xmath5 with respect to the weak and uniform topologies .    in the papers",
    "@xcite and @xcite , a new powerful method , based on the rokhlin lemma , was discovered .",
    "the authors called this method a cyclic approximation by periodic automorphisms .",
    "katok and stepin showed that the speed of approximation of an automorphism @xmath154 by periodic ones determines ergodic , spectral , and mixing properties of @xmath25 .",
    "in particular , the following result was proved :    the set of automorphisms admitting cyclic approximation with a fixed speed contains a dense @xmath139 subset in @xmath5 with respect to @xmath115 .",
    "it follows from this theorem that the set of automorphisms of rank 1 is generic in @xmath172 .    in the space @xmath173 , @xmath174",
    ", one can also consider the class of ( infinite ) measure preserving automorphisms . in this settings , there exists a number of results on typical behavior of infinite measure preserving automorphisms .",
    "we mention the following facts proved in @xcite and @xcite , respectively .",
    "@xmath121 incompressible ( conservative ) automorphisms acting on an infinite measure space form a dense @xmath139 subset in the uniform and weak topologies .",
    "+ @xmath123 automorphisms with finite ergodic index form a meager set , but those with infinite index are generic in @xmath175 , @xmath176 .",
    "recently , choksi and nadkarni @xcite proved that the set of non - singular automorphisms with infinite ergodic index is a dense @xmath139 subset in @xmath0 with respect to the weak topology .      to every automorphism @xmath25 , we can associate the full group @xmath48 $ ] generated by @xmath25 , the normalizer @xmath83 $ ] , and the centralizer @xmath85 . here",
    "we consider topological properties of these groups .",
    "notice that some of the results formulated below hold for more complicated groups of automorphisms than @xmath109 .",
    "[ full - gr ] @xmath121 the full group @xmath48 $ ] of any automorphism @xmath73 is a closed nowhere dense subset of @xmath0 in the uniform topology ; + @xmath123 the full group @xmath48 $ ] is a polish group in the uniform topology ; + @xmath125 the full group @xmath48 $ ] of any ergodic finite measure preserving automorphism @xmath25 is a meager dense subset in @xmath0 with respect to the weak topology ; + @xmath126 the full group @xmath48 $ ] of an ergodic automorphism @xmath25 is topologically simple in @xmath114 ; + @xmath127 the full group @xmath48 $ ] is contractible in the uniform topology .",
    "the first two results are simple exercises . in statement",
    "( 3 ) , the fact that @xmath48 $ ] is dense is also trivial , and the other part of the statement was observed by a.  kechris .",
    "the fact that for ergodic @xmath25 the full group @xmath48 $ ] has no uniformly closed normal subgroups follows from @xcite ( for type @xmath87 automorphisms ) and @xcite ( for type @xmath90 automorphisms ) . the last statement was proved in @xcite .",
    "we note also that the notion of full group is extremely useful in the study of problems related to the orbit equivalence theory of ergodic non - singular automorphisms .",
    "as shown in @xcite , full groups ( and topological full groups ) play a similar role in cantor dynamics .",

    "in this section , we define and study topologies on @xmath2 which are analogous to the weak and uniform topologies on @xmath0 .",
    "there exist many papers devoted to borel dynamics but , as far as we know , topologies on @xmath2 were first studied in our papers @xcite , @xcite , and @xcite .",
    "we first define two topologies on @xmath2 and then consider the topological properties of the space @xmath2 .",
    "given @xmath187 , denote by @xmath188 .",
    "but our main results concern mostly @xmath8 and @xmath9 , so that we do not consider the remaining topologies in this paper .",
    "] [ deftopologies ] the topologies @xmath8 and @xmath9 on @xmath2 are defined by the bases of neighborhoods @xmath189 and @xmath190 , respectively .",
    "they are : @xmath191 , @xmath192 , where @xmath193 @xmath194 in all the above definitions @xmath195 , @xmath196 , and @xmath197 .",
    "we call @xmath8 and @xmath9 the _ uniform and weak topologies _ , respectively .",
    "our motivation is as follows . for a standard borel space",
    ", we do not have a fixed borel measure on the underlying space .",
    "therefore , if we want to extend definitions ( [ d_u ] ) and ( [ d_w ] ) to @xmath2 , we have to take into account the set @xmath198 of _ all _ borel probability measures on @xmath13 . to generalize the definition of @xmath115",
    ", we observe that if the symmetric difference of two borel sets is arbitrarily small with respect to _ any _ @xmath199 , then these sets must coincide .",
    "notice that if the set @xmath200 were used in ( [ defuniftop ] ) instead of @xmath201 , then we would obtain the topology equivalent to @xmath8 .",
    "observe that the uniform topology @xmath8 is equivalent to @xmath202 which can be defined on @xmath2 similarly to the metric @xmath203 ( [ d_u ] ) .",
    "it is natural to consider two more topologies @xmath204 and @xmath205 on @xmath2 ( they are some modifications of @xmath8 and @xmath9 ) by considering only continuous measures and uncountable borel sets in definition [ deftopologies ] .",
    "[ conttopolborel ] the topologies @xmath204 and @xmath205 on @xmath0 are defined by the bases of neighborhoods @xmath206 and @xmath207 , respectively , where @xmath208 and @xmath209 are defined as in ( [ defuniftop ] ) and ( [ defweaktop ] ) with continuous measures @xmath210 and uncountable borel sets @xmath211 for @xmath212 .",
    "clearly , @xmath8 and @xmath9 are not weaker than @xmath204 and @xmath205 , respectively .    given an automorphism @xmath25 of @xmath213 , we can associate a linear unitary operator @xmath214 on the banach space @xmath215 of all bounded borel functions by @xmath216 .",
    "let @xmath217 be the topology induced on @xmath2 by the strong operator topology on bounded linear operators of @xmath215 .",
    "it was shown in @xcite that the topologies @xmath9 and @xmath217 are equivalent .",
    "this fact corresponds to the well known result in ergodic theory ( see theorem [ aut - w ] ) and is another justification of the name _ weak topology \" _ which is used to refer to @xmath9 .",
    "the following theorem proved in @xcite reveals some topological properties of @xmath2 with respect to the topologies we have defined .",
    "[ unifbor ] @xmath121 @xmath2 is a hausdorff topological group with respect to the topologies @xmath218 , and @xmath205 ; + @xmath123 the sets @xmath219 are closed in @xmath2 with respect to @xmath8 and clopen with respect to @xmath9 , that is @xmath220 is a 0-dimensional topological group ; + @xmath125 @xmath2 is a complete non - separable group with respect to @xmath8 and @xmath9 in the sense that every cauchy sequence of borel automorphisms converges to a borel automorphism ; + @xmath126 the group @xmath2 is totally disconnected in the uniform topology @xmath8 ; + @xmath127 the group @xmath2 is path - connected in the topology @xmath204 ; + @xmath128 the topology @xmath9 is equivalent to @xmath205 ; + @xmath221 the topology @xmath8 is not comparable with @xmath9 .",
    "let us give a few comments on the results from theorem [ unifbor ] .",
    "firstly , observe that , in contrast to the ergodic theory , the uniform and weak topologies are not comparable on @xmath2 . secondly , to see that that @xmath222 is totally disconnected , it suffices to notice the following facts : ( i ) the set of all automorphisms which have a fixed period at a fixed point is clopen in @xmath8 ( see theorem [ periodic](3 ) below ) and ( ii ) @xmath28 is the unique normal subgroup of @xmath2 which is not connected in its turn . on the other hand ,",
    "the fact that the topological space @xmath223 is path - connected ( proved in @xcite ) well corresponds to the results from @xcite , @xcite , @xcite mentioned in theorem [ aut - un ] .    it is obvious that the topologies on @xmath2 are not defined by convergent sequences , however , it is useful for many applications to know criteria of convergence .",
    "\\(1 ) @xmath132 converges to @xmath58 in @xmath8 if and only if @xmath224 such that @xmath225 .",
    "\\(2 ) @xmath132 converges to @xmath58 in @xmath9 if and only if for any borel set @xmath226 , @xmath227 for all sufficiently large @xmath37 .",
    "in particular , @xmath226 can be a point from @xmath10 .",
    "therefore , we see that @xmath9-convergence implies @xmath8-convergence .",
    "\\(3 ) observe that the criterion of convergence ( 1 ) does not hold for the topology @xmath204 .",
    "identifying borel automorphisms from @xmath2 which are different on an at most countable set , we obtain elements from the quotient group @xmath229 .",
    "observe that @xmath28 is a closed normal subgroup with respect to the topologies @xmath230 , and @xmath204 ( see @xcite and @xcite ) .",
    "denote by @xmath231 and @xmath232 the quotient topologies induced on @xmath228 by @xmath233 and @xmath9 , respectively .",
    "notice that the bases of the topologies @xmath234 and @xmath232 form by the sets @xmath235 and @xmath236 , respectively , with continuous measures @xmath237 and uncountable borel sets @xmath238 . the class of automorphisms equivalent to a borel automorphism @xmath25 we again denote by the same symbol @xmath25 and write @xmath239 .",
    "this identification corresponds to the situation in ergodic theory when two automorphisms are identified if they are different on a set of measure 0 ( mod-0-convention ) .",
    "the following theorem clarifies some topological and algebraic properties of @xmath240 .",
    "@xmath121 @xmath240 is a hausdorff topological group with respect to the quotient topologies @xmath234 and @xmath232 ; the topologies @xmath241 and @xmath234 are equivalent on @xmath240 ; + @xmath123 @xmath240 is an algebraically simple group ; + @xmath125 the group @xmath242 is path - connected .",
    "the second statement was proved in @xcite and the other results were obtained in @xcite .",
    "observe that the identification of automorphisms different on an at most countable set improves considerably the topological structure of the quotient group .",
    "apparently , one can conjecture the contractibility of @xmath240 in @xmath234",
    ". this would be parallel to the known result in the ergodic theory .",
    "we believe that the space @xmath243 has the topological and algebraic structures similar to those of @xmath149 .      in this section",
    ", we consider several natural classes of automorphisms and find their closures in the topologies we have defined above .",

    "the next lemma is one of the main tools in the study of borel automorphisms .",

    "the crucial importance of lemma [ markers - lemma ] may be partially explained by the following fact .",
    "it turns out that , having a vanishing sequence of markers , one can construct a sequence of kakutani - rokhlin partitions satisfying the following properties .",
    "[ k - r partitions ] let @xmath25 be an aperiodic borel automorphism of @xmath213 .",
    "there exists a sequence of k - r partitions @xmath288 of @xmath10 whose elements generate the @xmath12-algebra @xmath59 and such that : ( i ) @xmath289 ; ( ii ) @xmath290 refines @xmath291 ; and ( iii ) if @xmath292 is the height of @xmath284 , then @xmath293 as @xmath294 .    based on this result , we introduced in @xcite the concept of bratteli diagrams in the settings of borel dynamics .",
    "it was shown that one can associate an ordered bratteli diagram to every borel aperiodic automorphism @xmath25 such that @xmath25 becomes isomorphic to the vershik map acting on the space of infinite paths of the bratteli diagram .",
    "notice that the set of vertices at each level of the diagram ( i.e. , the number of towers in the k - r partitions ) can be chosen finite , and the ordered diagram corresponding to @xmath25 has no maximal and minimal paths .",
    "it is worthy to recall that the notion of bratteli diagrams was originally introduced in the theory of approximately finite @xmath295-algebras and then extensively studied by many authors in the setting of cantor minimal systems ( see , e.g. @xcite , @xcite , @xcite ) .",

    "let @xmath328 be a compact metric space . in this case , we can consider the group @xmath329 of borel automorphisms and its subgroup @xmath330 of homeomorphisms of @xmath10 .",
    "define for @xmath331 the topology of uniform convergence generated by the metric @xmath332 then @xmath333 is a complete metric space and @xmath330 is @xmath334-closed in @xmath2 .",
    "the case when @xmath335 is a cantor set is considered in section 4 ( see @xcite , @xcite for details ) .",
    "it is not hard to see that in cantor dynamics the topology on @xmath3 generated by @xmath334 is equivalent to the topology @xmath9 defined by clopen sets only .",
    "but in borel dynamics the topologies @xmath334 and @xmath9 are different . hence , it is interesting to find out which topological properties are preserved under embedding of @xmath3 into @xmath336 endowed with the topologies @xmath334 and @xmath9 .",
    "we note also that the topology generated by @xmath334 on @xmath2 depends , in general , on the topological space @xmath328 .",
    "nevertheless , we think it is worthy to study the topological properties of @xmath2 and @xmath330 for a fixed compact ( or cantor ) metric space @xmath10 because one can compare in this case these properties for the both groups .",
    "the first problem we discuss for the metric @xmath334 is to find the closure of aperiodic borel automorphisms of @xmath10 with respect to @xmath334 .",

    "in this section , we consider the uniform and weak topologies in the settings of cantor dynamics .",
    "we define two topologies on @xmath3 which are similar to the uniform and weak topologies used in borel dynamics .",
    "our primary goal is to study the global topological properties of @xmath3 and compare these properties with those known for the groups @xmath2 and @xmath0 .",
    "\\(i ) the uniform topology @xmath8 on @xmath3 is defined as the relative topology on @xmath3 induced from @xmath363 .",
    "the base of neighborhoods is formed by @xmath364 ( ii ) the topology @xmath9 is defined on @xmath3 by the base of neighborhoods @xmath365 all measures in ( [ deftau ] ) are taken from @xmath17 , and all the sets in ( [ defweak ] ) are assumed to be clopen .",
    "apparently , the most natural topology on the group @xmath3 is the topology @xmath334 of uniform convergence which is generated by the metric @xmath366 ( @xmath367 is a metric on @xmath368 compatible with the topology ) .",
    "recall that this topology can be induced from @xmath369 ( [ metricd ] ) .",
    "it is not hard to show that on the group @xmath3 the topologies @xmath9 and @xmath334 are equivalent and , as in the borel case , the topologies @xmath8 and @xmath9 are not comparable ( see details in @xcite ) .",
    "now we formulate several statements concerning topological and algebraic properties of @xmath3 .",
    "[ propertieshomeo ] @xmath121 the group @xmath3 is simple .",
    "+ @xmath123 @xmath3 is a hausdorff topological group with respect to the topologies @xmath8 and @xmath9 .",
    "+ @xmath125 @xmath370 is a @xmath371-dimensional perfect polish space and non - archimedean topological group .",
    "+ @xmath126 the topological space @xmath372 is totally disconnected .",
    "+ @xmath127 the group @xmath3 is dense and non - closed in @xmath373 .",
    "let us make a few comments on these results .",
    "the first statement is rather old and was proved in @xcite .",
    "the third result follows from the fact that the neighborhoods in ( [ defweak ] ) are closed , and the neighborhoods of the identity are subgroups of @xmath3 . to see that @xmath3 is totally disconnected in @xmath8 ,",
    "we observe the following facts : ( i ) by ( 1 ) , @xmath3 has no normal subgroups , and ( ii ) there are nontrivial clopen subsets in @xmath3 ( for example , the set @xmath374 is clopen with respect to @xmath8 ) .",
    "the last statement can be reformulated as follows : every borel automorphism of @xmath368 is approximated in @xmath8 by a homeomorphism .",
    "this is a form of luzin s theorem .",
    "a similar approach can be also found in @xcite and @xcite .",
    "recall that @xmath375 such that @xmath376 . on the other hand ,",
    "@xmath377 such that @xmath378 , and @xmath9-convergence is equivalent to the uniform convergence , i.e. , in the metric @xmath334 .",
    "we will discuss in this section the problem of approximation of aperiodic homeomorphisms by periodic ones . recall that @xmath40 denote the set of ( pointwise ) periodic homeomorphisms and @xmath253 is the set of periodic homeomorphisms with finite period .",
    "we begin with the following result proved in @xcite which asserts the existence of k - r partitions for aperiodic homeomorphisms .",
    "[ towers ] let @xmath25 be an aperiodic homeomorphism of @xmath368 .",
    "given a positive integer @xmath379 , there exists a partition @xmath380 of @xmath368 ( a k - r partition ) into a finite number of @xmath25-towers @xmath284 such that the height @xmath292 of each tower is at least @xmath381 .",
    "the idea of the proof is the following . given @xmath382 , find a clopen partition of @xmath383 such that @xmath384 for @xmath385 .",
    "set @xmath386 and @xmath387 for @xmath388 .",
    "notice that the set @xmath389 is clopen and meets every @xmath25-orbit at least once .",
    "therefore for every @xmath390 there is @xmath391 such that @xmath392 .",
    "the function of the first return defines a k - r partition @xmath393 of @xmath368 with base @xmath148 such that the height of every @xmath25-tower from @xmath393 is at least @xmath381 .",
    "based on this result , we prove a topological version of the rokhlin lemma ( the details are in @xcite ) which contains the following three results concerning approximation of aperiodic homeomorphisms by periodic ones .",
    "[ rokhlinlemmacantor ] ( rokhlin lemma ) let @xmath25 be an aperiodic homeomorphism of @xmath368 .",

    "apply again the above construction to the set @xmath406 taken as a base of @xmath393 .",
    "the other statements are consequences of this result .    * remark .",
    "* observe that theorem [ rokhlinlemmacantor ] allows one to construct a bratteli diagram associated to an aperiodic homeomorphism .",
    "moreover , one can show that every aperiodic homeomorphism of a cantor set can be represented as the vershik map acting on the path space of an ordered bratteli diagram ( see @xcite for more details ) .",
    "it turns out that , as in measurable and borel dynamics , the rokhlin property also holds in the group @xmath3 .",

    ", we will use the following convention : @xmath414 without further explanation .",
    "* simple homeomorphisms . * in the paper @xcite , a new interesting class of homeomorphisms was defined . by definition , @xmath415 is _ simple _ if it satisfies the following conditions .",
    "\\(i ) there exist non - empty clopen subsets @xmath238 and integers @xmath416 such that the collection @xmath417 is pairwise disjoint and @xmath58 has period @xmath418 on @xmath238 .",
    "\\(ii ) there exist clopen subsets @xmath419 and , for each @xmath420 , two disjoint periodic orbits @xmath421 and @xmath422 such that the sets @xmath423 are pairwise disjoint and spiral towards the periodic orbits of @xmath424 and @xmath425 , that is @xmath426    \\(iii ) the space @xmath368 may be represented as @xmath427\\ ] ]    it follows from the definition that every simple homeomorphism @xmath58 contains a periodic part and there may exists a clopen set @xmath297 such that @xmath428 or @xmath429 .    in @xcite , the authors proved the following important result which was used to establish the rokhlin property in @xmath3 .",

    "this section contains our results on the description of closures of some natural subsets in @xmath3 with respect to the topologies @xmath8 and @xmath9 .",
    "the notation @xmath60 , @xmath101 , @xmath102 was introduced in section 1 .",
    "denote also by @xmath470 the set of topologically transitive homeomorphisms . clearly , @xmath471 . as in ergodic theory",
    ", one can define the set @xmath472 of homeomorphisms of rank 1 but it is not hard to show that this set coincides with @xmath60 .",
    "the following definition was introduced in @xcite : a homeomorphism @xmath25 is called _ moving _ if for every proper clopen set @xmath226 each of the sets @xmath473 and @xmath474 is not empty .",
    "we denote the class of moving homeomorphisms by @xmath475 .",
    "it is clear that @xmath476 and @xmath477 .",
    "the next results were proved in @xcite .",
    "[ classeshomeom ] @xmath121 the sets @xmath478 and @xmath479 are nowhere dense in @xmath370 .",
    "+ @xmath123 @xmath60 is a dense @xmath139-set in @xmath412 .",
    "+ @xmath125 @xmath60 is an @xmath480-set in @xmath481 .",
    "+ @xmath126 @xmath482 and @xmath483 .",

    "the following interesting theorem was proved .",
    "[ topentropy ] @xmath121 for a compact metric space @xmath6 , the set of homeomorphisms having zero entropy is a @xmath139 subset in @xmath7 in the topology of uniform convergence .",
    "+ @xmath123 the set of homeomorphisms having zero entropy is a dense @xmath139 subset in @xmath409 .",
    "+ @xmath125 the set of homeomorphisms of the hilbert cube having infinite topological entropy contains a dense @xmath139 subset in the topology of uniform convergence .",
    "this is also true for a finite dimensional cube .",
    "* subgroups of @xmath3 generated by a homeomorphism . * in this section , we discuss topological properties of full groups , normalizers , and centralizers of cantor systems .",
    "let @xmath25 be an aperiodic homeomorphism .",
    "it is easy to prove that the full group @xmath48 $ ] is closed and nowhere dense in @xmath372 . on the other hand , @xmath48 $ ]",
    "is not closed in @xmath370 , but @xmath48 $ ] is still nowhere dense .",
    "the following theorem asserts that the full group of a minimal homeomorphism @xmath25 is separable since the topological full group is a dense countable subgroup in @xmath48 $ ] in the topology @xmath8 .",
    "notice that this result is not true , in general , with respect to the topology @xmath9 .",
    "we find the class of minimal homeomorphisms for which the @xmath9-closures of @xmath110 $ ] and @xmath48 $ ] coincide .",
    "we say that a minimal homeomorphism @xmath25 is _ saturated _ if for any two clopen subsets @xmath148 and @xmath301 with @xmath486 for every @xmath25-invariant measure @xmath22 there is @xmath487 $ ] such that @xmath488 @xcite .",
    "observe that the class of saturated homeomorphisms contains odometers and does not contain the chacon homeomorphisms . by theorem [ classeshomeom](2 ) , the class of saturated homeomorphisms is generic in @xmath475 with respect to @xmath9 .",
    "[ fullgroupscantor ] let @xmath25 be a minimal homeomorphism of @xmath368 .",
    "+ @xmath121 the topological full group @xmath110 $ ] is @xmath8-dense in @xmath48 $ ] .",
    "+ @xmath123 @xmath489}^p=\\{s\\in { homeo(\\omega ) } : \\mu\\circ s=\\mu \\mbox { for all } \\mu\\in m_1(t)\\}$ ] .",
    "+ @xmath125 @xmath25 is saturated if and only if @xmath490}^p=\\overline { [ t]}^p$ ] . + @xmath126 if @xmath25 is of rank 1 ( odometer ) , then @xmath491 .",
    "the first and third statements are proved in @xcite .",
    "the second result is taken from @xcite , and ( 4 ) is a rather simple observation noticed in @xcite .",
    "for a homeomorphism @xmath436 , let @xmath492 denote the set @xmath493 $ ] . although @xmath253 is not dense in @xmath370 , the following result holds .",
    "the first statement follows from theorem [ periodichomeo](1 ) , and ( 2 ) was proved in @xcite .",
    "@xmath121 let @xmath25 be a homeomorphism of @xmath368 , then @xmath494 $ ] .",
    "+ @xmath123 let @xmath25 be a minimal homeomorphism of @xmath368 , then @xmath495.$ ]    let @xmath25 be a homeomorphism of a cantor set @xmath368 . then @xmath25 can be also considered as a borel automorphism of @xmath496 .",
    "therefore , one can define two full groups @xmath48_c$ ] and @xmath48_b$ ] : @xmath497_c = \\{s\\in { homeo(\\omega ) } : sx \\in \\{t^nx\\ |\\ n\\in { \\mathbb z}\\ } \\",
    "\\forall x\\in { \\omega}\\},\\ ] ] @xmath497_b = \\{s\\in aut({\\omega},{\\mathcal b } ) : sx \\in \\{t^nx\\ |\\ n\\in { \\mathbb z}\\ } \\",
    "\\forall x\\in { \\omega}\\}\\ ] ] where @xmath297 and @xmath301 stand for cantor and borel .",
    "obviously , @xmath110_c\\subset [ t]_c \\subset [ t]_b$ ] and @xmath48_b$ ] is closed in @xmath336 with respect to @xmath8 .",
    "recall that by theorem [ fullgroupscantor ] ( 1 ) we have that for a minimal homeomorphism @xmath25 , @xmath498_c}^\\tau \\cap { homeo(\\omega)}= [ t]_c.\\ ] ]    the problem of finding of the closure of @xmath110_c$ ] in @xmath499 with respect to @xmath8 was solved in @xcite where the following result was obtained .",
    "let @xmath25 be a minimal homeomorphism of a cantor set @xmath368",
    ". then @xmath490_c}^\\tau = [ t]_b$ ] .",
    "this theorem has been recently generalized to any aperiodic homeomorphism @xmath25 by medynets .",
    "we finish this section by considering a topology on the normalizer @xmath83 $ ] of @xmath437 . by definition ,",
    "the ( topological ) normalizer of a homeomorphism @xmath437 is the group @xmath83=\\{s\\in { homeo(\\omega ) } : s(orb_t(x))= orb_t(sx)\\mbox { for all } x\\in x\\}$ ] . in @xcite , the following topology on @xmath83 $ ]",
    "was introduced : for @xmath500 $ ] , borel probability measures @xmath501 , and @xmath141 define @xmath502 : d(r , p)<{\\varepsilon}\\ \\mbox { and } \\mu_i(e(rt^nr^{-1 } , pt^np^{-1}))<{\\varepsilon},\\ ; i=1,\\ldots , k , n\\in { \\mathbb z}\\}$ ] .",
    "the sets @xmath503 form a base of a topology @xmath71 .",
    "the following result is due to @xcite .",
    "@xmath504,\\lambda)$ ] is a complete separable topological group .",
    "in this section , we discuss the results from sections 2 - 4 .",
    "the reader can see that many of the formulated theorems are similar for measurable , borel , and cantor dynamics .",
    "this observation shows that the three dynamics have common properties in the topologies we have studied .",
    "it is seen that if the topological groups from the table are connected then they are path - connected . the rokhlin lemma and rokhlin property hold for all these groups . recall that by the rokhlin property in the uniform topology we mean the density of conjugates of any aperiodic transformation in @xmath41 .",
    "another common property for these groups is the density of periodic transformations .",
    "this fact allows one to approximate every transformation by periodic ones . on the other hand ,",
    "the set of aperiodic is closed and nowhere dense in all the dynamics .",
    "however , inside of the set of aperiodic transformations , we can find dense subsets consisting of transformations which are of ergodic \" type , i.e. odometers , minimal homeomorphisms .",
    "as seen from the table and obtained results , the best analogue of the space @xmath149 in borel dynamics is apparently the quotient group @xmath510 ( or @xmath511 .",
    "note that we have not considered properties of @xmath3 with respect to @xmath204 .",
    "we think it may be interesting to do this .",
    "a similar comparison of these groups with respect to the weak topologies , @xmath115 and @xmath9 , shows that they do not have much in common in contrast to the uniform topology .",
    "nevertheless , we can point out some common features .",
    "firstly , the set of aperiodic transformations is dense for each of these groups in the weak topology .",
    "secondly , the rokhlin property holds in @xmath0 , @xmath228 , and @xmath3 .",
    "moreover , the following two facts hold : ( i ) the transformations of zero entropy are typical for @xmath0 and @xmath3 , ( ii ) rank 1 automorphisms are typical in @xmath5 and odometers ( or rank 1 homeomorphisms ) are typical in the space @xmath512 , the closure of all minimal homeomorphisms .",
    "based on theorem [ classeshomeom ] , one can suppose that the set @xmath475 endowed with the topology @xmath9 is an analogue of the space @xmath135 .",
    "on the other hand , the group @xmath0 is contractible in the weak topology , but @xmath319 and @xmath370 are totally disconnected topological spaces .    for a cantor set @xmath368 ,",
    "the topology of uniform convergence defined by the metric @xmath334 and the topology @xmath9 are equivalent .",
    "if @xmath513 is a compact metric space then the topology @xmath334 and @xmath9 on @xmath2 are different .",
    "it is interesting to compare topological properties of @xmath370 and @xmath333 .",
    "we see that the set @xmath41 of periodic transformations is dense in @xmath514 , @xmath409 , and `` almost '' dense in @xmath333 .",
    "we hope that the further study of possible relations between these topologies will lead to new interesting results .",
    "rokhlin , selected topics from the metric theory of dynamical systems ( russian ) , _ usp . mat .",
    "nauk ( n.s . ) _ , * 4 * ( 1949 ) , no .",
    "2 , 57128 ( engl .",
    "transl . in ` amer .",
    "translations ' , * 49 * ( 1966 ) , 171  240 ) ."
  ],
  "abstract_text": [
    "<S> this survey is focused on the results related to topologies on the groups of transformations in ergodic theory , borel , and cantor dynamics . </S>",
    "<S> various topological properties ( density , connectedness , genericity ) of these groups and their subsets ( subgroups ) are studied .            in this paper </S>",
    "<S> , we intend to present a unified approach to the study of topological properties of transformation groups arisen in ergodic theory , borel , and cantor dynamics . </S>",
    "<S> we consider here the group @xmath0 ( and @xmath1 of all non - singular ( measure preserving , resp . ) </S>",
    "<S> automorphisms of a standard measure space , the group @xmath2 of all borel automorphisms of a standard borel space , and the group @xmath3 of all homeomorphisms of a cantor set @xmath4 . the basic technique in the study of transformation groups acting on an underlying space is to introduce various topologies into these groups which make them topological groups and investigate topological properties of the groups and their subsets ( subgroups ) .    </S>",
    "<S> the study of topologies on the group of transformations of a space has a long history . </S>",
    "<S> the first significant results in this area are the classical results of oxtoby and ulam on the typical dynamical behavior of homeomorphisms which preserve a measure @xcite . </S>",
    "<S> this circle of problems has attracted attention in various areas of dynamical systems , notably , in measurable and topological dynamics , where it is important for many applications to understand what kind of transformations is typical for certain dynamics . </S>",
    "<S> of course , this problem assumes that a topology is defined on the group of all transformations .    </S>",
    "<S> the topologies which are usually considered on the groups @xmath0 and @xmath5 were defined 60 years ago in the pioneering paper by halmos @xcite where he called them the uniform and weak topologies . </S>",
    "<S> the use of these topologies turned out to be very fruitful and led to many outstanding results in ergodic theory . </S>",
    "<S> for instance , the best known theorems concerning ergodic , mixing , and weakly mixing automorphisms of a measure space were obtained by p.  halmos and v.a .  </S>",
    "<S> rokhlin ( see @xcite , @xcite , @xcite , @xcite ) . </S>",
    "<S> many further statements on approximation of automorphisms of a measure space can be found in the book @xcite and in a great number of research and expository papers written in last decades ( see , e.g. , the references to this survey ) .    motivated by ideas used in ergodic theory , we define several topologies on the groups @xmath2 and @xmath3 which are similar to the weak and uniform topologies . </S>",
    "<S> they were first introduced in the context of cantor dynamics in @xcite and @xcite where we marked that many results in cantor dynamics have their counterparts ergodic theory . </S>",
    "<S> then , we used these topologies to the study of the groups @xmath2 and @xmath3 in the series of papers @xcite , @xcite , @xcite , @xcite . to the best our knowledge , topologies on the group </S>",
    "<S> @xmath2 had not been considered before . on the other hand , </S>",
    "<S> there exist a few useful topologies on the group of homeomorphisms of a topological space @xmath6 . </S>",
    "<S> the most known of them is the topology of uniform convergence on @xmath7 ( or the compact - open topology ) . </S>",
    "<S> many remarkable results about topological properties of @xmath7 were obtained for a connected compact metric space @xmath6 ( see , e.g. @xcite and the references there ) .    in our study of the groups @xmath2 and @xmath3 , we noticed that most of topological properties known for @xmath0 hold also for borel and cantor dynamics . </S>",
    "<S> based on this observation , we have tried to systematize the known results for measurable , borel , and cantor dynamics to emphasize some common features and point out the existing distinguishes . in the article , we consider the global topological structure of these large groups . </S>",
    "<S> we also study some classes ( subsets , subgroups ) of transformations which are naturally defined , for instance , periodic , aperiodic , minimal , odometers , etc . </S>",
    "<S> the closures of these classes are found in the topologies we have defined . </S>",
    "<S> we consider here the problems and results which are parallel in ergodic theory , borel , and cantor dynamics . </S>",
    "<S> it will be seen below that the groups we study have a lot of similar topological properties . </S>",
    "<S> this observation is a justification for studying topologies on the groups of transformations in an unified manner .    </S>",
    "<S> the paper is organized as follows . in the first section , </S>",
    "<S> we collect main definitions and notions used in ergodic theory , borel , and cantor dynamics . </S>",
    "<S> our goal is two - fold : we fix the notation used in the paper and try to make the paper self - contained ( this may be useful for non - specialists ) . </S>",
    "<S> section 2 contains the well known results on applications of the weak and uniform topologies in ergodic theory . </S>",
    "<S> we do not intend to give a comprehensive description of all results related to topological properties of @xmath0 and @xmath5 . </S>",
    "<S> they are too numerous to list here . </S>",
    "<S> our choice is explained by interest and knowledge , and , all above , by our study of topologies in the context of borel and cantor dynamics . </S>",
    "<S> the next two sections contain the results on topologies on the groups @xmath2 and @xmath3 . </S>",
    "<S> we define two topologies @xmath8 and @xmath9 which are analogous to the uniform and weak topologies in measurable dynamics and formulate many results on topological properties of these groups and various subsets and subgroups . </S>",
    "<S> in particular , we consider periodic , aperiodic , minimal transformations , odometers etc . in the last section , we give a comparison of results obtained in measurable , borel , and cantor dynamics .    </S>",
    "<S> while preparing this survey , we improved several results from our previous works and included them in the paper with sketches of the proofs . </S>",
    "<S> we also used the nice written papers @xcite , @xcite where one can find many results on topological properties of the group of automorphisms of a measure space and the group of measure - preserving homeomorphisms of a compact connected manifold .    </S>",
    "<S> in this survey , we do not discuss many remarkable results which have been published during last decade in borel and cantor dynamics . in this connection </S>",
    "<S> , we refer to @xcite , @xcite , @xcite , @xcite , @xcite where further references can be found . </S>"
  ]
}
